dataDictionary.Title: PDS4 Data Dictionary
dataDictionary.Description: This document is a dump of the contents of the PDS4 Data Dictionary

class.title: Ancillary_Product
class.description: The Ancillary_Product class identifies an ancillary measurement related to a Spectral Library specimen.

class.title: Ancillary_Product_Internal_Reference
class.description: The Internal_Reference class is used to cross-reference other products in PDS4-compliant registries of PDS and its recognized international partners.

class.title: Measurement_Instrument
class.description: The Measurement_Instrument class contains attributes that identify the instrument that made the measurement.

class.title: Measurement_Instrument_Internal_Reference
class.description: The Internal_Reference class is used to cross-reference other products in PDS4-compliant registries of PDS and its recognized international partners.

class.title: Measurement_Parameters
class.description: The Measurement_Parameters class contains attributes relevant to a single measurement of a specimen.

class.title: Specimen_Classification
class.description: The Specimen_Classification class provides information about how a specimen has been classified.

class.title: Specimen_Parameters
class.description: The Specimen_Parameters class provides information about a specimen for which measurements have been made.

class.title: Spectral_Library_Product
class.description: The Spectral_Library_Product class provides information about a data product in the Spectral Library.

attribute.title: ancillary_product_type
attribute.description: The ancillary_product_type element provides the type of data found in an ancillary product.

PermissibleValue.valueMeaning: IR spectroscopic technique in which placing a sample next to a high refractive index crystal causes total internal reflection resulting in an evanescent wave that samples shallow properties of the sample
Elemental or oxide abundances for samples
Technique in which the sample is heated and temperature is monitored to evaluate exothermic and endothermic reactions that are indicative of composition
Microprobe technique in which the sample is bombarded with electrons, with resultant X-ray emission spectra indicative of sample composition
An image of the sample
Sample mineral abundances defined as weight or volume percentages
Spectroscopic technique based on based on inelastic scattering of monochromatic light, usually from a laser source
Spectroscopic technique based on measuring the spectral properties of light scattered from samples
Technique in which sample mass is measured as its temperature is increased
Spectroscopic technique based on measuring the spectral properties of light transmitted through samples
X-rays diffracted by a sample as a function of incident angle are used to determine sample crystal structure
Spectroscopic technique in which the sample is bombarded by high-energy X-rays or gamma rays, with fluorescent X-ray emission spectra indicative of sample composition

attribute.title: instrument_name
attribute.description: The instrument_name element provides a descriptive name of the instrument that made a spectral measurement.

attribute.title: data_producer_name
attribute.description: The data_producer_name element provides the name of the creator of the product. For products in RELAB, the value of data_producer_name is always "RELAB".

attribute.title: data_provider_name
attribute.description: The data_provider_name element provides the full name of the person who submitted the product to the library.

attribute.title: emission_angle
attribute.description: The emission_angle element provides the angle between the local vertical at the intercept point and a vector from the intercept point to the sensor.
attribute.unitId: arcmin, arcsec, deg, hr, mrad, rad

attribute.title: incidence_angle
attribute.description: The incidence_angle element provides the angle between the local vertical at the intercept point and a vector from the intercept point to the detector.
attribute.unitId: arcmin, arcsec, deg, hr, mrad, rad

attribute.title: measurement_atmosphere_composition
attribute.description: The measurement_atmosphere_composition element identifies any gas(es) present in measurement environment.

attribute.title: measurement_atmosphere_description
attribute.description: The measurement_atmosphere_description decribes the atmospheric conditions through which the data was taken.

attribute.title: measurement_atmosphere_pressure
attribute.description: The measurement_atmosphere_pressure element provides the atmospheric pressure of the measurement environment.

attribute.title: measurement_atmosphere_relative_humidity
attribute.description: The measurement_atmosphere_relative_humidity element provides the relative humidity of the measurement environment.

attribute.title: measurement_atmosphere_temperature
attribute.description: The measurement_atmosphere_temperature element provides the temperature of the measurement environment.

attribute.title: measurement_date_time
attribute.description: The measurement_date_time element identifies the date and time of the observation and measurement.

attribute.title: measurement_geometry_type
attribute.description: The measurement_geometry_type element identifies the type of geometry at which a measurement is taken.

PermissibleValue.valueMeaning: Measurement taken when light is sent in to the specimen at a certain direction and in a cone-like shape and received at a certain direction and in a cone-like shape.
Measurement taken when light is sent in to the specimen at a narrow angular range and received over a narrow angular range
Measurement taken when light is sent in to the specimen at a certain direction and received in all directions (perhaps in an integrating sphere).
Measurement taken when light is sent in to the specimen at all directions and received in all directions (perhaps in an integrating sphere)
The measurement geometry is unknown.

attribute.title: measurement_notes
attribute.description: The measurement_notes element contains relevant notes about how a measurement was made.

attribute.title: measurement_reference_standard
attribute.description: The measurement_reference_standard element identifies the standard object on which observations are performed in order to calibrate a measurement.

attribute.title: measurement_requestor
attribute.description: The measurement_requestor element identifies the individual or laboratory who requested the measurement. It may occur more than once.

attribute.title: measurement_source_description
attribute.description: The measurement_source_description element identifies the source used for the measurement such as the type of lamp, heating element, laser, or radioactive source.

attribute.title: measurement_type
attribute.description: The measurement_type element identifies the type of spectroscopy performed on a specimen.

PermissibleValue.valueMeaning: Attenuated total reflectance (ATR) is a sampling technique used in conjunction with infrared spectroscopy which enables samples to be examined directly in the solid or liquid state without further preparation.
The Emission value indicates emission spectroscpy, which examines the wavelengths emitted by atoms or molecules during their transition from an excited state to a lower energy state.
LIBS (Laser-Induced Breakdown Spectroscopy) uses a highly energetic laser pulse as its excitation source to produce emission spectra.
The Raman value indicates Raman spectroscopy, which determines information about a material by studying the Raman scattering of monochromatic light off the material.
The Reflectance value indicates reflectance spectroscopy, the study of light as a function of wavelength that has been reflected or scattered from a material.
The Transmission value indicates transmission spectroscopy, the study of light as a function of wavelength that has been transmitted through a material.
The X-Ray Diffraction value indicates x-ray diffraction spectroscopy, which studies the diffraction patterns of x-rays scattered off a material.
The X-Ray Fluorescence value indicates x-ray flourescence spectroscopy, which examines the emission of x-rays from a material previously bombarded with high energy x-rays or gamma rays.

attribute.title: phase_angle
attribute.description: The phase_angle element provides the angle between incidence and emission vectors.
attribute.unitId: arcmin, arcsec, deg, hr, mrad, rad

attribute.title: segment_number
attribute.description: The segment_number element identifies which segment of a merged spectrum is described by a Measurement_Parameters class. The first segment is segment number 1. If the spectrum is not merged from multiple segments, then the value of segment_number is 1.

attribute.title: spectral_range_max
attribute.description: The spectral_range_max element identifies the maximum value at which a given data item was sampled. For example, a spectrum that was measured in the 0.4 to 3.5 um spectral range would have a spectral_range_max value of 3.5.

attribute.title: spectral_range_min
attribute.description: The spectral_range_min element identifies the minimum value at which a given data item was sampled. For example, a spectrum that was measured in the 0.4 to 3.5 um spectral range would have a spectral_range_min value of 0.4.

attribute.title: spectral_range_parameter_name
attribute.description: The spectral_range_parameter_name element identifies the name of the parameter which determines the sampling interval of the measurement.

PermissibleValue.valueMeaning: The Angle value means the spectra is a function of angle.
The Energy value means the spectra is a function of energy.
The Frequency value means the spectrum is a function of frequency.
The Time value means the spectra is a function of time.
The Wavelength value means the spectrum is a function of wavelength.
The Wavenumber value means the spectrum is a function of wavenumber.

attribute.title: spectral_range_unit_name
attribute.description: The spectral_range_unit_name element identifies the unit of measure for the values specified by spectral_range_min and spectral_range_max.

attribute.title: spectral_resolution_width_max
attribute.description: The spectral_resolution_width_max element identifies the maximum width of a spectral band in a given spectrum. If all bands are the same width, spectral_resolution_width_min and spectral_resolution_width_max will have the same value.

attribute.title: spectral_resolution_width_min
attribute.description: The spectral_resolution_width_min element identifies the minimum width of a spectral band in a given spectrum. If all bands are the same width, spectral_resolution_width_min and spectral_resolution_width_max will have the same value.

attribute.title: spectral_resolution_width_unit_name
attribute.description: The spectral_resolution_width_unit_name element identifies the unit of measure for the values specified by spectral_resolution_width_min and spectral_resolution_width_max.

attribute.title: spectral_sampling_interval_max
attribute.description: The spectral_sampling_interval_max element identifies the maximum distance between band centers in a given spectrum. If all band centers are equally spaced, spectral_sampling_interval_min and spectral_sampling_interval_max will have the same value.

attribute.title: spectral_sampling_interval_min
attribute.description: The spectral_sampling_interval_min element identifies the minimum distance between band centers in a given spectrum. If all band centers are equally spaced, spectral_sampling_interval_min and spectral_sampling_interval_max will have the same value.

attribute.title: spectral_sampling_interval_unit_name
attribute.description: The spectral_sampling_interval_unit_name element identifies the unit of measure for the values specified by spectral_sampling_interval_min and spectral_sampling_interval_max.

attribute.title: material_common_name
attribute.description: The material_common_name element gives the specific name of the specimen material, as specifically as it is known. For example, if a specimen is pure olivine, put "Olivine". If a specimen is a mixture of kaolinite and opal, put "Kaolinite/Opal". Indicate if "Unidentified".

attribute.title: material_origin
attribute.description: The material_origin element identifies whether the specimen is natural or synthetic.

PermissibleValue.valueMeaning: The Natural value indicates that the specimen was not made in a laboratory.
The Synthetic value indicates that the specimen was made in a laboratory. A synthetic sample could be either a physical mixture of natural materials or a laboratory synthesized material.

attribute.title: material_state
attribute.description: The material_state element identifies the physical state of the specimen.

PermissibleValue.valueMeaning: The Gas value indicates that the specimen is in the gas state.
The Liquid value indicates that the specimen is in the liquid state.
The Solid value indicates that the specimen is in the solid state.

attribute.title: material_subtype
attribute.description: The material_subtype element identifies the material subtype of the specimen.

attribute.title: material_type
attribute.description: The material_type element indicates the general type of the specimen.

PermissibleValue.valueMeaning: Sample without crystalline structure or long range order, e.g., glass
Sample that is cemented or otherwise aggregated into a solid mass
Sample composed of a single element such as metallic iron
Solid sample composed of gas or liquid (e.g., water vapor or water) now in solid form
Sample with a given composition within a defined range of compositions and that exhibits a defined crystalline structure
Sample composed of organic materials
Solid sample composed of one or more minerals
Sample composed of a single particle
Sample of loose or disaggregated material that is a mixture of various minerals and/or other compounds

attribute.title: mineral_subtype
attribute.description: The mineral_subtype element identifies the mineral subtype of the specimen.

attribute.title: mineral_type
attribute.description: The mineral_type element identifies the type of mineral to which the specimen belongs.

PermissibleValue.valueMeaning: The Arsenate value indicates the specimen is an arsenate.
The Borate valeu indicates the specimen is a borate.
The Carbonate value indicates the specimen is a carbonate.
The Chromate value indicates the specimen is a chromate.
The Cyclosiliate value indicates the specimen is a sorosilicate.
The Halide value indicates the specimen is a halide.
The Hydroxide value indicates the specimen is a hydroxide.
The Inosilicate value indicates the specimen is a inosilicate.
The Iodate value indicates the specimen is an iodate.
The Native Element value indicates the specimen is a native element or an alloy.
The Nesosiliacte value indicates the specimen is a nesosilicate.
The Nitrate value indicates the specimen is a nitrate.
The Organic Compound value indicates the specimen is an organic compound.
The Oxide value indicates the specimen is an oxide.
The Phosphate value indicates the specimen is a sulfate.
The Phyllosilicate value indicates the specimen is a phyllosilicate.
The Sorosilicate value indicates the specimen is a sorosilicate.
The Sulfate value indicates the specimen is a sulfate.
The Sulfide value indicates the specimen is a sulfide.
The Tectosilicate value indicates the specimen is a tectosilicate.
The Unclassified value indicates that the specimen doesn't fit into any of these categories, but is still a mineral.
The Vanadate value indicates that the specimen is a vanadate.

attribute.title: organic_type
attribute.description: The organic_type element identifies the organic type to which the specimen belongs.

PermissibleValue.valueMeaning: The Inorganic value indicates the specimen is not an organic material.
The Mixture value indicates the specimen is a mixture of organic and inorganic material.
The Organic value indicates the specimen is an organic material.

attribute.title: rock_subtype
attribute.description: The rock_subtype element identifies the rock subtype of the specimen.

attribute.title: rock_type
attribute.description: The rock_type element identifies the type of rock the specimen is.

PermissibleValue.valueMeaning: The Igneous value indicates that the specimen is volatile-poor and was formed by the cooling of magma or lava.
The Metamorphic value indicates that the specimen was formed by metamorphic processes (e.g., increased temperature and/or pressure conditions that altered the rock composition without melting)
The Sedimentary value indicates that the specimen was formed by sedimentary processes (e.g., lithification of unconsolidated material, direct chemical precipitation)
The Unknown value indicates that there is not enough information about the specimen to assign it a rock type

attribute.title: specimen_type
attribute.description: The specimen_type element gives one or more terms that classify the origin of the specimen.

PermissibleValue.valueMeaning: The Lunar Meteorite value means the specimen is a sample from a lunar meteorite.
The Mars Meteorite value means the specimen is a sample from a Mars meteorite.
The Other Meteorite value means the specimen is a sample from a meteorite that is not a lunar or Mars meteorite.
The Returned Asteroid Sample value means the specimen is an asteroid sample returned by a mission.
The Returned Lunar Sample value means the specimen is a lunar sample returned by a mission.
The Synthetic Sample value means the specimen is a laboratory-generated sample.
The Terrestrial value means the specimen is a terrestrial sample.

attribute.title: synthetic_processing_description
attribute.description: The synthetic_processing_description element describes how a synthetic specimen has been processed.

attribute.title: synthetic_type
attribute.description: The synthetic_type element identifies the process by which the specimen was produced synthetically.

PermissibleValue.valueMeaning: Sample that is entirely human-made
A natural product chemically or mineralogically altered by a laboratory treatment (e.g., heating). Does not include size and magnetic separates of natural samples or washing by water.
Portions of an instrument, e.g., portions of a spectrometer that contribute to a spectroscopic signature and thus need to be characterized
Sample that is a mixture of human-made and naturally occurring components

attribute.title: volatile_type
attribute.description: The volatile_type element indicates whether the material was volatile-poor (less than 2.0% LOI) or volatile-rich (greater than 2.0% LOI).

PermissibleValue.valueMeaning: The Poor value indicates the specimen had less than 2.0% LOI.
The Rich value indicates the specimen had greater than 2.0% LOI.
The Unknown value indicates the specimen's volatile type is unknown.

attribute.title: source_specimen_id
attribute.description: The source_specimen_id element identifies the source specimen from which the observed specimen is derived.

attribute.title: specimen_collection_location
attribute.description: The specimen_collection_location element provides the place where the specimen was collected.

attribute.title: specimen_description
attribute.description: The specimen_description element provides a short description of the specimen.

attribute.title: specimen_id
attribute.description: The specimen_id element uniquely identifies the specimen.

attribute.title: specimen_max_size
attribute.description: The specimen_max_size element identifies the maximum particle size of the observed specimen.
attribute.unitId: AU, Angstrom, cm, km, m, micrometer, mm, nm

attribute.title: specimen_min_size
attribute.description: The specimen_min_size element identifies the minimum particle size of the observed specimen.
attribute.unitId: AU, Angstrom, cm, km, m, micrometer, mm, nm

attribute.title: specimen_name
attribute.description: The specimen_name element identifies the specimen as it is named where it is being kept.

attribute.title: specimen_owner_location
attribute.description: The specimen_owner_location element provides the institution or laboratory name where the specimen resides.

attribute.title: specimen_owner_name
attribute.description: The specimen_owner_name element identifies the individual or laboratory to whom the specimen belongs.

attribute.title: measurement_segments
attribute.description: The measurement_segments element gives the number of measurement segments that were combined to create the spectrum. If the spectrum is not merged from multiple segments, then the value of measurement_segments is 1.

attribute.title: processing_description
attribute.description: The processing_description element provides information about how measurement(s) for a particular product were made, in addition to the information given in the Measurement Parameters class. In the case of a product created by merging multiple measurements, this element describes how the merge was done.
